list_definition.definition: a person who cuts and makes suits, overcoats etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He has his clothes made by a London tailor.

list_definition.definition: to make and fit (suits, coats etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He has his suits tailored in London.

list_definition.definition: to make (something) fit the circumstances; to adapt

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He tailored his way of living to his income.

list_ex_of_english: As such, assessment is tailored online to accommodate the test taker's estimated ability and confront the examinee with items that best measure that ability.
The importance of tailoring interventions to meet the needs of t he individual patients has also been emphasized.
Will medicine become a practice of tailoring molecules?
Their suggestion that studies be carefully tailored to their real-world target behaviors implies that experimenters only use one procedure if it is relevant.
Predictive research thus can inform the design of prevention programs and permit interventions to be tailored to those at highest risk.
Experience can refine the subject's representation, promoting tolerance and help that is tailored to the object's needs.
Their results suggested that interventions particularly tailored to specific deficits might be more efficacious than general stimulation and rehearsal.
The relationship of drapery to the underlying structure is clearly of fundamental significance and leads to a clearer distinction between tailored and draped architecture.
